trans-unit.source: This exception is thrown whenever there is a problem with the user's custom toolset definition file.
The problem might be semantic or syntactical.
If the problem is in the syntax, it can typically be caught by XSD validation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply" This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The error code.
This parameter can be a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref>).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The error code.
This parameter can be a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref>).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException"></xref> class.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The error code.
This parameter can be a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref>).
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `innerException` parameter is not a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]), the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
Gets the exception error code that was thrown.
A string representing the error code.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with information about the exception.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
